intro: Heuchera columbiana, commonly known as the Pacific heuchera, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It features attractive, heart-shaped leaves that range in color from deep purple to bronze and green, depending on the variety and environmental conditions. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in partial to full shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its ornamental foliage and adaptability contribute to its value in both ornamental horticulture and native plant landscapes.
